cosmology.name: The Great Wheel
cosmology.description: The default D&D cosmology includes more than two dozen planes. The most common understanding visualizes them as concentric wheels, with the material realms at the center. The Inner Planes form a wheel around the Material Plane, enveloped in the Ethereal Plane. The Outer Planes form another wheel around that one, arranged according to alignment, with the Outlands linking them all.

alternateConfigurations.name: World Tree
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes situated among the roots and branches of a great cosmic tree (literally or figuratively)

alternateConfigurations.name: Vertical Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Material realms suspended between two other realities: the astral realms (the Astral Plane and the Outer Planes) above and the elemental realms (the Inner Planes) below

alternateConfigurations.name: Simplified Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: A cosmology with fewer planes: a Material Plane; the Transitive Planes; a single undifferentiated Elemental Plane; an Overheaven; and an Underworld

alternateConfigurations.name: Orbital Cosmology
alternateConfigurations.description: Planes arranged in a complex system of orbits, with planes exerting greater influence on the Material Plane the closer they draw to it

planeCategories.name: Material Realms
planeCategories.description: Most D&D worlds are located on the Material Plane, which has two planar echoes: the Feywild and the Shadowfell.

planeCategories.name: Transitive Planes
planeCategories.description: The Ethereal Plane and the Astral Plane are boundless realms that provide passage between other planes of existence.

planeCategories.name: Inner Planes
planeCategories.description: The four Elemental Planes (Air, Earth, Fire, and Water), plus the Para-elemental Planes between them, are the Inner Planes.

planeCategories.name: Outer Planes
planeCategories.description: Seventeen Outer Planes correspond to the nine alignments and shades of philosophical difference between them.

planeCategories.name: Positive and Negative Planes
planeCategories.description: These two planes enfold the rest of the cosmology, providing the raw forces of life and death that underlie all existence in the multiverse.

planes.name: Para-elemental Plane of Magma
planes.philosophicalEssence: The interaction between the stability and rigidity of earth and the vibrancy, passion, and change of fire. Represents creation through the fusion of elemental earth and elemental fire.
planes.emotionalInfluence: The Para-elemental Planes represent the interaction and sometimes the contrast between the forces and ideals embodied by their constituent elements.

physicalProperties.shape: A great range of volcanic mountains forming the boundary between the Plane of Earth and the Plane of Fire
physicalProperties.atmosphereNotes: The air reeks of sulfur in the regions nearest the Plane of Magma (as described at the Furnaces on the Plane of Earth). Lava and volcanic activity dominate the landscape.

temperature.description: A volcanic mountain range with lava flowing down slopes. The Furnaces nearest this plane have lava seeping through caverns and air reeking of sulfur.

physicalProperties.weatherPatterns: Volcanic activity with lava flows down the slopes toward the Plane of Fire

timeFlow.description: No specific time flow rules are given for the Para-elemental Plane of Magma.

planarConnections.name: Border with Elemental Plane of Earth
planarConnections.description: The Furnaces are the mountains on the Plane of Earth nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma. Lava seeps through their caverns, and the air reeks of sulfur. The dao have great forges and smelting furnaces here to process ores and shape precious metals.

planarConnections.name: Border with Elemental Plane of Fire
planarConnections.description: Lava flows down the slopes of the volcanic mountains toward the Plane of Fire. The Sea of Fire on the Plane of Fire is fed by lava flowing through the Fountains of Creation.

civilizations.name: Azer Communities
civilizations.description: Azers are native inhabitants of the Plane of Magma.

civilizations.name: Fire Giant Settlements
civilizations.description: Fire giants make their home on the Plane of Magma.

civilizations.name: Red Dragon Lairs
civilizations.description: Red dragons inhabit the volcanic mountains of the Plane of Magma.

adventureThemes: Interaction and contrast between earth (stability, rigidity, tradition) and fire (vibrancy, passion, change)
Creation and destruction through elemental fusion
Fundamentally similar to volcanic environments found on the Material Plane

crossReferences.description: The Furnaces on the Elemental Plane of Earth are described as the mountains nearest the Para-elemental Plane of Magma, with lava seeping through caverns and sulfurous air.
The Sea of Fire on the Elemental Plane of Fire is fed by lava flowing through the Fountains of Creation (Para-elemental Plane of Magma).

planarTravelMethods.name: Ethereal Curtain to Para-elemental Plane of Magma
planarTravelMethods.description: In the Deep Ethereal, curtains of vaporous color lead to the Border Ethereal connected to specific Inner Planes. A maroon-colored curtain leads to the Para-elemental Plane of Magma.
requirements: Access to the Deep Ethereal via Plane Shift, Gate, or magical portal
risks: Travel through the Deep Ethereal takes 1d10 × 10 hours between curtains

planarTravelMethods.name: Planar Vortex to Plane of Magma
planarTravelMethods.description: Vortices join an Elemental Plane with a very similar location on the Material Plane, such as a swirling pool of magma in the heart of a volcano leading to the Plane of Fire or nearby para-elemental regions.
requirements: Finding a suitable volcanic vortex location

savingThrowProbabilities.formula: P(fail | modifier m) = max(0.05, min(0.95, (DC - 1 - m) / 20))
